content: will be an even number of stitches between the markers in this photo taken after the second increase the first increase after setup the 4 increases are marked with blue dots two stitches come out of one stitch below there are now 4 stitches between the markers the green lines trace the path of the original two knit columns with the new stitches growing in between note that the original columns of stitches are outside of the markers waum mitts v 3 © tracy hill 2018 2020 6 picking up thumb stitches picking up stitches for the thumb is not an exact science as long as you pick up more stitches across the side of the thumb that joins the hand than you will eventually need it s okay but some knitters have commented that they would like more guidance on this part so here is how i do it i start with the side of the thumb that joins the hand and turn the mitt so that the top is closest to me and the gusset points away i m right-handed so it s easiest for me to work right to left first i put two stitches from the waste yarn on my dpn next i look for loops that go across the palm side of the thumb hole and slip them on to the needle marked with blue dots below sometimes it helps to use the tip of another needle to pick up the loops and position them on the new needle once i ve picked up the loops from the palm side of the thumb hole i put the first two stitches from the other end of the waste yarn on the needle that side is now ready waum mitts v 3 © tracy hill 2018 2020 7 next i slip two more needles into the stitches on the waste yarn when all of the stitches are secured pull out the waste yarn in the example pictured i had 18 stitches on the waste yarn and i picked up 5 stitches across the palm side the palm side needle has 9 stitches and the other two needles have 7 stitches each for a total of 23 to get to 16 stitches i need to remove 7 stitches by decreasing leave a long tail when you start your yarn so that you can use the tail to sew up any gaps at the end if necessary the first row of the thumb is all knit stitches again i start with the palm side and decrease stitches as needed to get close to the final number of stitches i want for that needle i think it s easiest to do the ribbing if you have an even number of stitches on each needle so that you always start with a knit stitch and end with a purl waum mitts v 3 © tracy hill 2018 2020 8 on the palm side needle i knit 2 together through the back
